greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of solutions of the congruence y^2  == x^3 + x^2 + x (mod p) as p runs through the primes.
comment: The discriminant of the elliptic curve y^2  = x^3 + x^2 + x is -3.
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) is the number of solutions of the congruence y^2  == x^3 + x^2 + x (mod prime(n)), n >= 1.
example: n,  P(n), a(n)\ Solutions (x, y) modulo P(n)
results.author: _Wolfdieter Lang_, Apr 18 2016
